website_summaries.verdict: For all-around versatility, this top end model is definitely one to consider, especially with limited space.
pros: Includes ceramic grill plates, baking dish, panini press, and muffin pan
Digital panel controls temperature, with a 500 degree searing option
All plates are removable and dishwasher safe
cons: Ceramic plates are not durable, and may crack and stick over time

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic Plates Are Bad On This
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good grill, but the Ceramic Plates have issues. After about 10 uses, the top ceramic plate is no longer non stick and I can't get it clean at all. The bottom plate is fine, but the top plate has completely failed. I do a lot of searing so my thoughts are that might of damaged the top plate. I have always followed the directions of cleaning the plates, and like I said the bottom plate has no problems at all. I have attached a pictures of the top plate after trying to clean it for 5-10 min.
customer_reviews.author: Edward H Sherman

customer_reviews.title: ... you're a true George Forman appliance owner I would recommend the "Evolve"
customer_reviews.text: If you're a true George Forman appliance owner I would recommend the "Evolve". Includes removable porcelain coated standard grill plates and additional Deep Dish tray. Omelets and fatata's are perfect in the deep dish tray. Egg whites, avocado.... Adjustable temperature settings. Use Sear function for Panini's and wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B.

customer_reviews.title: breaks easily/very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: this is not the first one i've owned of this george foreman model. these are poorly made, fall apart easily and the 'non stick' trays do not remain non stick after only a few uses. the issue i've had with this one is the base cracked so it isn't strong enough to stay put and it tips over. poorly made and cheap materials must have been used in order for it to break after using it for a week in total since i had this. i am very disappointed with the quality of this grill. i do not recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: rg

customer_reviews.title: Huge money saver
customer_reviews.text: VERY impressed by this little grill! I have been able to cook meat and grill veggies so much more evenly than pan cooking them in my apartment. It is quick to cook meat and leaves a nice sear while also draining all the fat off the meat and into the tray for dumping. The only struggle I have run into is determining the proper cook time for the meat since the thickness changes the cook time and the machine tends to cook the outside of the meat fairly quickly. It seems to be a trial and error process for me, but otherwise, has been a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Two years of great cooking
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grill almost two years ago and used it extensively. It cooks evenly and quickly. The plates are easily cleaned (although they did get a bit more difficult to clean as time passed) and operation is simple, We loved this grill! About a month ago, however, we tried to turn it on and it just gave a weak beep and made a click like a relay opening and closing. I've looked for a repair solution to no avail. I don't want to buy an new one every two years, so back into research mode I go. I don't know if this was a fluke or if it represents the workmanship of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of which color you click on page
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 4800 4-1 and got this instead because they did the color game on the page. I have no use for a waffle iron grill. The 4-1 apparently only comes in the red, and only if you click the right one. Otherwise it changes to this inferior offer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The plastic handles used to remove the grill plates is fairly fragile.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third George Foreman Grill I have owned, and it has the most features and flexibility. The only problem is that two of the plastic handles used to remove the grill plates have broken. They still work, but the outside shell is cracked. I haven't found where I can get a replacement for this. My previous grill was the "George Forman Next Grilleration" and all of the grill plates are still in good shape. I was pleasantly surprised when the grill plates from these two models are interchangeable. I bought this grill with the Omelet Plates, and the Deep Bake Dish Plate and really like both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Glenn Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Much Improved
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Foreman grills, but I got rid of my last one many years ago because of Teflon. I decided to give it another go with the ceramic plates. I really like it. This is the biggest model I've ever had. I like that you can adjust the tilt for that drainage, and then lie it flat to use as a Panini press. I only use soap, water and a soft kitchen sponge to clean the ceramic plates. I have had no chipping or of any kind. I also like that the print the meats, temperatures, and cooking times on the inside of the unit that is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Deronda

customer_reviews.title: Easier to clean, still not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my OLD family size one, it's ok Smaller than my old one, but takes up just as much space. The oversized top to add the extended handle makes it take to easy more space than needed. Doesn't seem to get as hot as my old one. But way easier to clean with the removable plates Be nice if the plates were reversible rather than needing a while other set to try to store. For being 10yrs newer doesn't seem like it advanced much.
customer_reviews.author: thebigbry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has removal plates for cleaning. It comes with plates for waffles, but it does not get hot enough for waffles. The temperature only goes up to 425 deg while a waffle iron goes up to almost 500 deg. The waffles never got brown. In addition, the batter ran all over the sides and got into the places that were extremely hard to clean. When I did burgers, one side got brown, but the other side did not. a good indication the heat is not even of consistent. I have several other plates that I have not tested yet.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love the new heat controls.
customer_reviews.text: Just whatever you do, don't follow the directions for waffles. I did and poured just over 1 &1/2 cups and it went everywhere, ruining the machine. The recipe calls for 2 cups of batter. Had to be a misprint. One cup would have been enough. I never got to try it on anything else but I will use the replacement and review that one. It does have excellent heat controls over original models. Got my replacement and love it. There is a learning curve because of the heat controls and it takes longer to heat up then my old on but this one made great steaks, burgers and waffles using only 1/2 of the batter as directed in directions.
customer_reviews.author: ihopie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe next time!
customer_reviews.text: Used it three times: once for burgers, once for waffles, 3rd time the sear function never ended and when the lights went out on the unit it never came on again! Amazon support hand held me through the visit with the George warranty service 3 days after the Amazon return date had past. A new one is coming tomorrow. Maybe next time will be the Winner!?
customer_reviews.author: SuperCoder

customer_reviews.title: Biggest piece of garbage I have ever owned! DO NOT BUY THIS PILE OF EXCREMENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is impossible to clean. Sure the detachable trays are nice; but it drips out the sides, down the back out the front. It gets into all of the "moving parts" the latches etc. I got so angry trying to clean out every screw hole and eyelet that I finally threw the thing into the trash. This is the biggest waste of money I have ever spent on Amazon. I absolutely hate everything about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrrin

customer_reviews.title: Loose hinges
customer_reviews.text: Bought it does its job but the back left hinge is not as secure as the right side causing it not close properly got a replacement then the new one had the same problem. Now I will return it for my money back not sure what to think about George foremans! Photo below are pictures of the left and right hinges.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Serving Size
customer_reviews.text: This grill by no means holds 5 servings of food. Maybe 5 chicken drumsticks or 5 small burgers (McDonalds size) or 5 very small chicken thighs. But 5 pork chops, 5 strip steaks, 5 chicken breasts? Not possible. The only way to get 5 ADULT size portions of most foods would be to jam them so tightly together that they don't cook properly. I tried 5 chicken breasts squashed and tucked in together and because they were touching, the sides of them were obviously steamed and not grilled.
customer_reviews.author: Raul H. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ok. But a little disappointed. I needed something easy to use and to clean up that cooks great food. Easy to use, not so easy to clean up but the cooking is not very good. It's made from cheap aluminum, does not handle very high heat. And no matter what you cook it smokes. I ordered the cup cake pan, I wanted to cook some breakfast muffins. It was awful. My counter under the unit got really hot, the unit smoked the entire time and the muffins did not get done in the middle but burned on the top. There are better solutions out there. I would not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Toni House

customer_reviews.title: Cooks and cleans up great
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this George Foreman Evolve! It Cooks great! Easy to clean. Loved it so much I bought one for my daughter and son-in-law. She cooked with it and was so impressed with how fast and easy her meal was cooked. It is a breeze to clean the griddles. Super easy all around. I would highly recommend this to others. I've made steaks and pork chops and totally love the sear feature. So glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: apricotsyum

customer_reviews.title: Defective Time and Temp!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to use this cooker for 6 months I gave up and threw it away last week. I never could get the time and temp settings to work properly, which limited the function of the unit. I had high hopes for this product. But it didn't work for me! Other Foreman Grills I've owned through the years have been wonderful, so I couldn't believe this product was so bad!
customer_reviews.author: Tuxedo Cat

customer_reviews.title: A real flop
customer_reviews.text: My advice to you? Don't buy this for these reasons: 1) the waffle iron plates don't heat evenly and scorch the waffles on the left side before the right side of the waffle is cooked; 2) the meat you cook must be VERY thinly sliced or the SEAR function doesn't work; 3) I've cooked chicken breast, hamburger, steak, cod and tilapia on this and they all come out very dry; my dietician explained that's what it's designed to do--cook away all fat, but that includes juices too. I think I'll go back to my pressure cooker. That way at least, the meat comes out juicier AND mostly fat free.
customer_reviews.author: MizGee

customer_reviews.title: Great George Foreman grill
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described. TheEvolve grill is the best George Foreman products. It is easy to adjust the height for steaks, chicken, or hamburger. Durable, easy to use the temperature and timer control, and it really makes your cooking easier. I would recommend this product to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Really love the Forman 5-serving grill
customer_reviews.text: Really love the Forman 5-serving grill. The ceramic coating on the plates is why I bought it and I am "Not" disappointed. They are holding up very nicely showing no signs of wear. I use it at least 3 times a week on average and I've had it for awhile now. Cooks evenly. The tilt feature is also great. One possible improvement to make this the absolute best would be to open it to a flat position for pancakes/eggs on both heating surfaces. Great product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Diego S. Terres III

customer_reviews.title: Waffleishous!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great BIG 4 banger waffle maker! The biggest cooker and best made with great drip control EVER!!! Easy to change plates. I need to buy the omelet plate it looks SO COOL!!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Been Georging for 20 years
customer_reviews.text: I've been through several iterations of Foreman's. Our last 8 burger one died after 15 years so we replaced it with this one. I taught my boys to cook using this and we all love the temperature control and that you can cook flat or tilted to drain off the excess fat. They also really love the extras that you can make with this one like omelets and muffins. Not as big as our last one but just enough to do what we need. My only negative is I like darker plates as the tan ones this has are easily stained.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: too many flaws to truly enjoy this grill
customer_reviews.text: grill plates are very easy to clean and degrease but all the buttons on the grill are very difficult to press down on that you worry about puncturing a hole with your finger. The grill itself is also very slow to get hot even if you use the sear button that goes straight to 500 degrees, so that takes time. The muffin pan must be used with the deep bake pan because it acts as a vessel or carrier so you could lock it in place in the lower plate section. Once everything heats up, it gets too hot and burns food too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Michi ElleTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this 10 stars, I would do just that!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, sooo easy to cook with. The plates change out easily. The timer and cook settings are a breeze. The clean up is terrific. The plate handles do not heat up so it makes clean up very simple. The ceramic plates clean up very easily. No staining the plate surfaces or scrubbing needed. After plates have cooled off, use paper towel to wipe out any grease, then set in dish dishwater or dishwasher. Everytime they clean up like new!!!!!! Remember. Do not use cooking sprays on ceramic plates.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for searing steaks
customer_reviews.text: I found the cooking surface of the grill very small. It says it can hold five servings but they would have to be for children. I originally bought the grill to sear steaks but they don’t taste seared, just slightly browned where the ridges of the grill touch the steak. The instructions say you can change the timer at any time which is not true because you cannot change the timer during the sear mode. This is my third George Foreman grill. I have been thrilled with them in the past but after so much use the surface became difficult to clean. I will continue to try cooking different types of food and perhaps update later.
customer_reviews.author: Love to read

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It takes it around 8-10 mins to fully heat up and it is easy to clean. I was not happy about how it arrived. It showed up in its box and not in an amazon box. With all the porch pirates everywhere, leaving the box open to everyone to see what exactly it was, wasn't smart on amazon's part. Luckily we were home when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: This is my "Go to" wedding gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd or 4th one I have purchased! I got one for myself, my husband is on a special diet, so lots of grilling food needed. We loved it so much that I purchased it as a wedding gift for a friend...she still keeps going on and on about how much she loves it, so next wedding? You got it...she got the same gift and also loves it...so it is now my "go to" wedding gift...which I will be ordering another one in a few weeks here.
customer_reviews.author: motherof7

customer_reviews.title: But like cooking without fats is great for dieting and good ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m from Missouri when it comes to these small electronic appliances and this one was no exception. But I’m sold on the Forman Grill now and bought a second unit for our winter home. Convenience is one reason - I think that’s why so many are sold - but I like cooking without fats which is great for dieting and good health. None of this would be any good if you can’t get a steak or other meat to carmelize on the grill. Much to my surprise the ‘sear’ setting does this admirably time and again. I’m sold! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dodger

customer_reviews.title: good but one glaring issue.
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to do a review. I like everything about this except that the hinge does not allow for this to close flush. the closer to the hinge you get the bigger the gap is between the plates. So if you put a hamburger patty on the back will get cooked slower than the front due to the gap. Ive found no way to adjust it. It takes a while to get up to temp and I dont know if it is me or what but it seems the temp indicator always flashes even when its reached the desired temp. Otherwise easy to use and cleanup is simple. The egg tray addon is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: I loved it except it was hard to clean and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the first George Foremans that ever came out. I loved it except it was hard to clean and the grill plates wore out. Then along came this verision this is absolute heaven in a portable grilling system. And you can buy extra plates that make it into a personal waffle maker, baker, and oven that makes you great for small spaces like RVs, apartments, and dorm rooms. It also offers a quick way to put dinner on the table in a full size kitchen. I don't think I could live without mine. And clean up is a breeze with the ceramic cook plates.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning; joints seem loose
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my early-generation Foreman this one cleans SO easily. I appreciate the waffle and grill attachments. The only thing that seems odd is the joints seem very loose and I definitely have to press down on the top or squeeze the handles together to make sure everything between the cooking surfaces makes contact. I have had a few semi-seared steaks before learning that the hard way. I imagine it is to enable cooking different thickness food but the execution seems off.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Very good, takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Sears really well, big enough for 6 good size burgers. This will be my 5th George Foreman and so far the best. I took a star off for short cord, I like to put this on my electric stove top so I can use the exhaust above it and although the socket is less that a foot from the stove the cord will not reach, also the timer goes off at 5 mins after you start heating it, even if the grill isnt hot enough.....say its on sear, you have to wait at least another five mins for the second timer, the instructions are not very forthcoming....
customer_reviews.author: Yvette A.

customer_reviews.title: Detachable plates make for easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit along with an extra set of waffle plates about a month ago. This grill takes up a little more space on the counter than my previous Hamilton Beach grill, but works much better. So far I've used this Foreman grill for sausages, strip steaks, burgers and waffles. The included cooking instructions are accurate, a 0.75" steak is cooked to medium in 6-7 minutes plus an additional 10 minutes for preheating. Cleanup is easy since the plates are detachable and can be hand washed or put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This grill is a must buy!!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE this grill!! We have used it for every meal for the last 3 days and we couldn't be happier. Eating better will definitely be easier with this kitchen gadget! We have made chicken breasts twice now and each time the chicken has been so moist and tender. The waffle plates are also great. The plates do not need greased at all. The waffles just slide right off! We will definitely be buying some of the other plates that are made to go with it so we can really see what this baby can do! It is a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: I know people post issues with the non-stick plates so I was reluctant to purchase but I have not had any issues with them. I don't use this grill all the time so while it doesn't get regular use, I do have a habit of not cleaning the plates right away. Even with them sitting... I have been able to clean them easily with a short soak in the sink. The only issue I have had is that it slides a bit on the counter when opening and closing and I have to constantly push the drip tray back under so it doesn't make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this at the urging of a teenage son. We were not certain it would get used, or that it would work well. We were mistaken on both counts. Our son uses this almost daily to make sandwiches. We have taken it on trips in our travel trailer, and it makes great sandwiches. We also have used it for waffles and it worked great. The waffles are huge though. We would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: FL-Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Do not overfill
customer_reviews.text: The grids are easy to clean, but be careful do not over fill for waffles. What a mess to clean-up It runs into every crack!! It was my fault trying to get too much batter in. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mokie

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great but.....
customer_reviews.text: We like the grill and the ceramic coating however it seems that closing the grill has caused chipping along the right edge. My advice when closing grill after it is cooled down and cleaned place a towel between grill to keep it from rubbing. Beep signal need to be louder and the control from timer to temperature is difficult to use. You are never sure which one is active.
customer_reviews.author: Dlong74

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!!
customer_reviews.text: Well here it is a few months later & I'm finally writing a review. I wanted to wait until I had used in order to give good info for any potential buyers of this product. Many reviews were negative, i.e., uneven heating, burning, wouldn't clean easily, etc. I have used my grill many many times in the past few months and have never had one single problem. Cooks evenly and cleans up like a breeze! I wash by hand and not in dishwasher. Can't speak to the baking pan or muffin pan as have not used these.
customer_reviews.author: Judith C

customer_reviews.title: Best grill I've ever used!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this its so easy to clean. The food just wipes off even when I burn cheese. The different trays are so awesome. It helps me save my stove because I don't have to use it so much. When I make tortas or sandwiches with this they come out awesome! So does eggs oh and carne asada meat in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: teegal

customer_reviews.title: OK for grilling but very bad for waffles.
customer_reviews.text: OK but has some issues. The ceramic grill plates aae a real plus. The waffle plates are a disaster (though I don't really make waffles much). The waffle batter easily seeps out the back and into areas you really can't clean out. I suspect if you are VERY VERY careful pouring the batter, you can avoid this problem but there is no excuse for this design problem.
customer_reviews.author: alt

customer_reviews.title: George Foreman GRP4842P Multi-Plate Evolve Grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to use in our travel trailer but tried it several times at home. It performs as advertised, which is excellent. My only complaint it the goofy timer/temperature control, not at all intuitive. The best feature is the grilling but a close second is clean up. The ceramic plates are very easy to clean, everything slides right off. I can cook four pork loins in about seven minutes and all the flavor is retained but not the grease from the fat.
customer_reviews.author: Redtail49

customer_reviews.title: Best Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase we've made in a long time on Amazon. I love this Grill! The ceramic plates are so easy to cook with and easy to slip off and clean -- either in the sink or in the dishwasher. I've cooked amazing food on this grill and am really happy with it. I have a bird and have to worry about the teflon coating. The ceramic grill plates help keep me from those worries so much anymore! NICE Grill! I am experimenting and cooking lots of neat things with it with the other attachments you can get with it!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the temp settings. There are no instructions on recommended settings for various uses. Still works fine though. I think it would improve the flexibility of use if there were some recommended settings so that you didn't have to experiment as much -- hate to ruin a meal.
customer_reviews.author: roy56339

customer_reviews.title: Best version yet!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really digging this version of the George Foreman. The places are easily removable and washable. So far I've had nothing stick to the grill plates - where as that did become an issue in one of the previous versions that I owned. I've used the normal grill plates as well as the deep dish plate and everything came out well. You'll want to be sure that you have a meat thermometer on hand though. The first chicken breast that I tried came out too dry...but once I used the meat thermometer with round 2 of chicken it came out nice and juicy. I've had 3 versions so far, and this one by far is the best in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who wore out his last Forman grill. I wasn’t sure he’d like it with all the bells and whistles. I was wrong! He loves it! Not only can he grill meats, he can fry eggs, potatoes and make corn bread muffins and his favorite brownies! He’s a happy camper which makes me a happy camper, plus I love the red color! He really likes the sear feature which truly makes for a great steak or chop. I like that I don’t have to cook as often, so it’s a win-win for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Snowcat60Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If you want to cook more than a couple burgers at once, get a larger model.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was bigger. The picture shows it cooking sliders, not real burgers. If you want to cook more than a couple burgers at once, get a larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Buller

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean-up. Don't know why it says 3-in-1 when ...
customer_reviews.text: We use the grill a couple times a week. Easy clean-up. Don't know why it says 3-in-1 when I only got 2 sets of plates. I will say, the waffle plates are not Belgian waffle plates so that was disappointing but not nearly as disappointing as having the waffles split in the middle by sticking to both top and bottom plates. Difficult in knowing when the waffles were done. Regular waffle irons beep. Also the cookbook doesn't give temperature or time guidelines so that was a waste of time and money on the manufacturer's part. If you're looking for a two-sided grill for meat I'm sure any brand will do just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl57

customer_reviews.title: Love it! 😍
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving this GF Evolve! So easy! Cooks food great! Saw people complaining about how the hinges are loose but they are supposed to be so they can adjust to the thickness of the meat or whatever your putting on grill plates! And as for the people complaining on how long it takes to heat up... I can tell no difference in my old GF to my new one... I personally think they heat up within the same amount of time! I’ve cooked chicken and breakfast sausage on it so far and I love it! Hope this help anyone who is questioning on Whether to get it or not!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Please fix upper plate coating!@
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first. Note, the upper plates have a design flaw. The coating is VERY tyhin and others have stated, looses nonstick fast. I loved the ceramic option; however, the upper plates are not coated properly. You can see at the beggining that the lower is thicker, shinny but the upper is thin and 'hazy' and starts to get build up fast. The adjustable side height works well for thick items; however, for thin things like bacon, the upper plate is too high. Not a big issue, just have to turn it over.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P Miller

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect size George Foreman
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size George Foreman. The night it arrived I washed the grates, as instructed, and we cooked 10 pounds of chicken breasts to prepare for the week's lunches. It cooked them in no time and they were cooked perfectly! The grill came with a skillet pan and a muffin tin. I don't think we will be using the muffin tin, but I am sure the skillet pan will come in handy. It is easy to clean and not too heavy to lift and put away in a cabinet when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cooking surface but get an extension cord for it.
customer_reviews.text: Non stick surface is fantastic. My burgers don't cling to the top plate anymore when I open the grill. This grill is also backward compatible with my old grill so I've got extra, seldom used attachments as a bonus. All in all, I love it, except that they still have an extremely short cord. I have to use an extension cord to place it where I need it to cook with. My old grill was worse, but it could use 6-12 more inches of electrical cord.
customer_reviews.author: Allen H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second George Foreman Evolve we've owned. Our first one was purchased for $20 from a yard sale and lasted us about six years. We literally wore the first one out so we bought this as a replacement. The newer version has some great improvements over the old design - bigger grease catcher tray, built-in handle, digital controls. I'm sure we'll get many years of use out of this one as well. For a large family you'd probably want a bigger size but for a couple this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ksc0967

customer_reviews.title: Love the new Design
customer_reviews.text: The new design of the George Foreman is great it makes it a whole lot easier to use and the tilt design for sandwiches versus draining grease off meat is absolutely wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it but small
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Works so much better than my old George foreman. And the removable plates allows me to finally clean the grill properly. If the played get damaged you can replace them which is the best part. They are ceramic coated and so non stick. Love love love. Only con. It's tiny. I can only put 2 sandwiches in it where I used to put 4-5 before. But I would totally recommend. I got waffle maker, griddle, and panini maker.
customer_reviews.author: Janeris

customer_reviews.title: Healthy cooking and easy
customer_reviews.text: Love using my Evolve Grill! Can grill meats with less fat and oh so quickly. Love making omelets and waffles too with easy. Grilled veggies are fantastic as well as muffins using the muffin plate. Wish I had bought this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Settle

customer_reviews.title: light wieght cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: returned tinny cheap quaility pieces awkward to put in and out bought a cusinart and although not perfect much better in every way heavier quaility, easier to put together larger cooking surface ect.
customer_reviews.author: RK Clark

customer_reviews.title: foremen grills Stands behind their products!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill, but the grills started to look burnt in the center after doing burgers many times; then i called George and they told me not to use spray on cooking sprays, this is what did the damage to the grill plates. George Foremen grill replaced the grill plates as a one time courtesy, Nice
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic plates hard to clean, also has hot and cold spots
customer_reviews.text: The versatility of the removable/interchangable plates is nice, but I find that the grill heats unevenly. One side is always hotter than the other. The ceramic plates are difficult to clean when compared with teflon coated plates. It's ok, but you have to move your food items around the plate so they heat evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Best Foreman I've used so far
customer_reviews.text: This is what ALL of the foreman grills should be like. Super easy to use and the searing feature is great! The cooking surfaces could not be easier to clean... best I've seen anywhere. I used this quite a bit in the last 2 months to give it a good testing and it's worth every penny so far.
customer_reviews.author: buyer187

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN!!! DON'T BUY  - Update They are Replacing it for Free.
customer_reviews.text: After using it a handful of times over about a month it stopped working. Plug it in and no response. Complete waste of money! Update - I filed a complaint with their customer service and they are replacing it at no cost! So, that's good. It was quick and simple. Their customer service is good.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: Problems with top grill plate multiple times.
customer_reviews.text: While the grill has worked for me as described, hence the two stars, but I have had problems with 3 different top grill plates. The original top grill plate seems to lose the coating that prevents food from sticking to it. I ordered a new set of grill plates. Meanwhile I sent an email to the George Foreman company about this (never got a reply). The second top plate had the exact same symptom as the first. One more order after this. The third set did the exact same thing. Each time the plates were washed in the dishwasher right next to the bottom plate with continues to remain non-stick. At this time, I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Short lived, caution
customer_reviews.text: I received this and used it a total of 5 times. The first time I used the "Sear" function it quit working. I checked the power on other items and the power was fine. The Unit was blank. No lights, no heating. it is just DEAD.
customer_reviews.author: A White

customer_reviews.title: Perfect multipurpose appliance
customer_reviews.text: We brought this after our first foreman gill stopped working after 5 years of heavy use. I’m so glad we upgraded to this version. It is so easy to clean and I love the feature of being able to tilt the grill. It’s perfect for when you need a flat surface. I also like all the options of plates for this model. Now we can eliminate having to have a separate waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but very difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my young adult son so he would cook more, and he loves what he can cook with it. However cleaning it is a real problem. We knew not to use any scouring pads on it, but after only about 6+ uses, we have stain marks all over it. It seems like grease burns very easily and without scouring it, the grease doesn't come off. I don't know how this compares to other brands, but if I were buying again I might look into other manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Paula from NC

customer_reviews.title: Plates are uncleanable after three uses
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job cooking. The sear function is decent. However, by the third use the plate are not longer able to be cleaned fully. We did not use spray non-stick which I know would cause problems. Seems to function fine with grill plates as is, just know that if you are expecting this to stay original color with no stains you shouldn't
customer_reviews.author: Bruin248

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Not even a year later the tip plate cant be cleaned and not the bottom wont heat at all. $90 for something that lasted 10 months
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah McQuiston

customer_reviews.title: Grilled some fish too and results are very good and tasty
customer_reviews.text: Grilled some steaks as soon as we got it...Grilled some fish too and results are very good and tasty... However,,, the manufacturer (George Foreman in China) needs to redesign the rubber footings... they keep coming off and almost lost them twice... I had to reinsert them every time until I put a bit of glue on them before remounting... and then taped them in place overnight... suggest they just use self sticking rubber footings instead...
customer_reviews.author: SuperGP

customer_reviews.title: Broken Drip Tray
customer_reviews.text: The grill works fine, but the drip tray arrived cracked. I've searched and I can't seem to find any reasonably priced replacements. We've just been making due. UPDATE 11/30/18: Lowered my rating from 3 stars to 1 star. The grill stopped working in September, only a year and a half after I bought it. I paid $90 for a grill that arrived with a broken tray and that pooped out after 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: tournesols

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: This grill isn't as heavy and solid as my old Foreman grill which lasted me more than 10 years. I find the "time/temp" selector a real pain in the butt. I've not had a problem with meat sticking to the plates, and it is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy U

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Used it the day it arrived. Was more secure in deciding that it was ready to cook than our old model. Nothing was sticking to the grill pans and the hamburgers slid down the pan when I opened the lid. Clean up was easy with just a sponge.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: 1st George Foreman Grill
customer_reviews.text: I used this throughout summer so I wouldn't heat up my kitchen. I love it. It has paid its way with cooked up broccoli that my son is obsessed with. I have used this to cook vegetables, grilled cheese, quesadillas, waffles, and bacon. Such a great purchase. I can't believe I had never owned a George Foreman before. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LauraH

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like Foreman grills but they heat up so slowly that I usually end up using the stove instead. It's not a new problem with this model or anything. Every one I've ever had is like that. What is unique to this model is there's one spot on one of the regular plates that for some reason is almost impossible to clean. I still use it when the stove is occupied with other foods. Slow, but works as expected. The sear feature is nice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this George Foreman The interchangeable cooking plates are easy to clean and the cooking space will hold 4 medium steaks or chicken breasts. Cooks quickly. Wish there was a recipe book included.
customer_reviews.author: Ewyatt

customer_reviews.title: This product is great! I had a panini machine before that was ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I had a panini machine before that was very hard to clean. With the removable cooking plates, this machine is very easy to clean which I seem to be doing a lot more because I use it for more than just sandwiches now. Because it cooks both sides of the food, it's very quick and a time saver when preparing a meal.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Linder

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Compared to Previous Models
customer_reviews.text: This grill is terrible. I have ordered Foreman grills for almost two decades now and have enjoyed them all immensely. This new version is pathetic though. The plates are not nearly as non-stick as before and the ceramic plates make such a horrible smell I have to turn my kitchen exhaust fan on. If you are an avid Foreman fan my advice is learn to cook on a real grill. This product is no longer a worthy substitute.
customer_reviews.author: loveamazon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Love the removable grill plates for cleaning and the different types of of plates. Makes cleanup super easy and can be used as a griddle, grill or muffin maker. My “only one star” review is due to the temp/timer button does not work. I can raise and lower the temp but when I try to set the timer, it will not change to timer mode. So, I set my temperature then have to use another timer to time my meals. Secondly, the hinge on right side is intact but doesn’t bend the same as left hinge causing scrapes on the nonstick surfaces of the grill and difficulty in closing the top. Disappointed in what should have been an awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.author: angela J.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this
customer_reviews.text: It was waste of my money. I didn't like it at all. When you bake anything here, it doesn't taste right. Baking should be cooked in an oven with hot air. But this one doesn't have room for air circulation so bread is not fluffy at all. In terms of grilling, it is not any better than the older, cheaper model. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Appletree

customer_reviews.title: Life changer!
customer_reviews.text: Every kitchen needs one. I'm in love with this thing and it's the best for cooking up a frozen chicken breast in under 15 minutes! Cleaning is so easy! I never have to scrub just run my soapy sponge across it a few times and rinse,
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Touch panel feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: The cheap $20 version of the grill worked much better in my humble opinion that did this unit. The heating surfaces are not uniform and the unit takes far longe r to grill simple things that the unit I had before. My final complaint would be that the buttons on the form of the unit do not feel solid and I suspect they are going to wear out far sooner than they should. I waited to long to evaluate and return, dont make my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer G. Browne

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a fancy George Forman grill. Has temp control and searing option. I live in an apartment that has kitchen and living all in same room so when I cook the whole apartment heats up. Not anymore. I love this little grill.
customer_reviews.author: Mariadi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use. Read all of the directions. Clean immediately after use. You will have no problems and great results.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not really non-stick
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed in this George Forman. Have had others in the past that work great, however this one, not so much. It's non-stick does stick, and it is hard to clean because of the porcelain finish. A little clunky working the temperature and timing controls.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Not for Me
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back. It's big and bulky. I got it mainly for the waffle grills. They were the old time grills and removable for washing. I was disappointed as it only made two squares at a time. I cannot find a waffle iron (regular) with removable grills. I got my old grill out for grilling meats, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: We also purchased all of the other plates. I love this little griller. I've cooked all sorts of things in it and it doesn't heat up my kitchen. You can bake, grill, Sautés, just about anything. Also makes great waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Psnyder

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: We are remodeling our kitchen. Gutted everything. I love this appliance. A feature allows the grill to tilt so grease can drip into a drip pan. I can choose to tilt the grill level for cooking an egg. The plates are easily removable for cleaning. We are taking it with us in our RV. I don't want to leave home without it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Black

customer_reviews.title: Clean up is a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: So happy with our new Geo. Foreman. Had our old one for 15 years. The new one is so easy to clean that means we use it more often.
customer_reviews.author: David Horn

customer_reviews.title: A little bit disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: Underneath the handles of the plates are too little rubber caps two of them are already gone.. the left side drives hotter than the right side uneven cooking no matter what temperature.. underneath the bottom of the plates creates a white powder on the aluminum the instructions say it's normal but it's quite annoying..
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Working perfect for 1 & a half years
customer_reviews.text: Updat on 8-27-2017 grill stopped working i push the power button & it turn on & off real quick but it did work well for a year & a half. Grill works good very satisfied the nonstick is easy to clean. When I first plugged it in I turned it on its highest heat setting I seen a little smoke for about 2 or 3 minutes I guess it have to burn off some oil no more issues after that. Update 6-2-2019 I purchased my 2nd grill on Nov. 10, 2017 & it lasted about a year & a half I will not purchase another one. It is a great grill wish it last longer
customer_reviews.author: Moot1

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: I make juicy steaks in 3 minutes. Nuff said, but I'll continue. Take a dry paper towel to wipe off the bulk of the mess while still warm and it hand washes easily. I store the plates in a lid holder stand which works great. Just don't forget the drip tray every single time because it's much easier to clean than grease on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Bought for our mom that just turned 82. She ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our mom that just turned 82. She asked for this by name and model number. Looked it up on Amazon and ordered in just a few clicks! She was absolutely tickled to death with it! She kept digging down in the box and pulling out attachments that came with it. Discussing each one and what she could do with it lol Very worth the money to me!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We loved our old George Foreman grills and used them a lot. It was time for a new one and this one is great. Also the plates from our old one fits this one. We did have a hinge problem with the 1st one of this model and was contacted directly by the mfg after my original poor review. They replaced it with a new one in less than a week. So this is an edited review and we still love our George Foreman grill!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: WHAT'S THAT SMELL
customer_reviews.text: My grill works well, had for a week, the only problem there is a smell after i cook my meat. It smells like burnt plastic
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH GARDNER

customer_reviews.title: Great got Better.
customer_reviews.text: While I have the original version of this product, this new one is outstanding because they have learned the lessons from the original model. The plates are changeable and can be dropped in the dishwater for easy washing. It has a temperature control which allows more precise cooking. Lighter in weight but very effective and pleasing to use.
customer_reviews.author: colonel

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It cooks meat well with minimal effort (Just make sure you watch steaks for the correct cook ie medium its really easy to overcook) Love making hot sandwiches with in in just a few minutes and I was super impressed at how nicely it cooked a cake (from a box cake mix) in just about 10 minutes. Very nice, very versatile product. Keep it in your kitchen for when you are to lazy to cook in a pan. =P
customer_reviews.author: Racheal B

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic plates are the best!
customer_reviews.text: The ceramic plates are well worth the money. Have had numerous George Foreman grills in the past that were difficult to clean. These ceramic plates clean easily without scrubbing and always look new.
customer_reviews.author: DebL

customer_reviews.title: Good food prepared quickly.
customer_reviews.text: So far everything that we have prepared using our new George Forman Evolve Grill has got done quickly and tasted way better than pan frying.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Comes in very handy
customer_reviews.text: Love this, no heating up big oven or slaving over hot burners cooking burgers or chicken.
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Cooks great .I especially like the fact that all plates are removable and dishwasher safe, makes cleanup easier and less time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn DeBord

product_meta.title: George Foreman 5-Serving Multi-Plate Evolve Grill System with Ceramic Plates, Deep Dish Bake Pan and Muffin Pan, Red, GRP4800R
product_meta.description: Color:4-in-1 Multi-Plate Red| Style Name:Multi-Plate"“Variety is the spice of life, ” they say. And if that’s true, life is extra spicy with the George Foreman Evolve Grill System in your kitchen. You can make so much food on this thing. It bakes, sautés, toasts, and does basically any other heated cooking you can think of. This model includes: ceramic-coated grill plates (grill protein, toast Panini), a bake dish (bake lasagna, sauté veggies), and a muffin pan (cook muffins, mini quiches, meatballs, and more—go wild! ). A few more awesome features complete the Evolve experience: digital time and temperature controls, 500°F searing for a tasty crust on steak and burgers, a floating hinge that accommodates thick cuts of meat, and an adjustable cooking angle for fat-removing sloped grilling or flat baking and cooking. Just pick from our collection of plates (others sold separately) and get cookin’—deliciousness awaits! *compared to standard George Tough non-stick coating**from 1/4lb. uncooked 80/20 ground chuck"
feature_bullets: Evolve 4-in-1 Versatility- Grill, Panini Press, Bake Dish, Muffin Pan. The Evolve is designed for maximum cooking versatility. This model includes ceramic grill plates (for grilling and Panini pressing), a bake dish (for baking, sautéing, and griddling), and a muffin pan (for muffins, single-serve quiches, meatballs, and more.) Additional plate types for the Evolve are available for purchase

Adjustable Cooking Angle – Use the slope or set it flat. You can drain excess fat from meat using the classic sloped grilling surface, or lay the grill flat when using the baking and muffin pans or creating gourmet Panini. A simple knob on the back of the grill makes it easy

Adjustable Hinge- The 1-inch adjustable hinge accommodates everything from thick cuts of meat to thin-cut vegetables. You can even grill up a hearty sandwich, putting the finishing touches on a sub or Panini. The hinge really comes in handy when using the muffin pan

Digital Control Panel- Delicious grilling starts with precise temperatures. The digital control panel displays the cooking time and grill temperature, which you can set from 325˚-450˚, plus a special button for the 500˚ searing burst. And cleanup is simple since the buttons are level with the grill exterior

5 Servings- Make meals the whole family will love! With 75 square inches of cooking surface, you can grill, bake, or toast, up to five servings of food all at the same time. Plus, with different plate options on the Evolve, you can make multiple types of food for a huge, complete meal in no time

Meals in Minutes- From plug-in to plate, it doesn’t get much faster than this. The Evolve preheats quickly, efficiently grills and bakes all types of food, and its easy to cleanup thanks to the nonstick, removable plates. George Foreman fits delicious cooking into your busy lifestyle

Remove 42% of Fat- The classic George Foreman Grill slope removes up to 42% of fat during cooking, conveniently draining grease into the dishwasher-safe drip tray. Plus, the nonstick ceramic surface allows you to skip the excess butter and oil in your cooking, further reducing the fat content without sacrificing the foods you love
Removable Plates- The grill plates are completely removable and dishwasher-safe. Cool-touch release features make it easy to handle the plates even if they're still warm. Wafle Pan not included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,199 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
